name: BiMEP, Biscay Marine Energy Platform
Type: Wave, offshore wind, mooring, material & equipment testing
Address: C/ Atalaia 2, bajo
access_conditions: TRL5-8. Developers to provide a detailed risk assessment and full documentation following our Guidance on Safety Considerations for the installation of Marine Renewable Energy Devices at bimep.
data_examples: BiMEP provides resource data and site studies. The scientific data acquired during the testing period is property of the developer.
services_offered: Biscay Marine Energy Platform (BiMEP) is an infrastructure for testing marine energy converters, located just off the coast of Armintza, northern Spain. With a grid connection capacity of 20 MW, purpose built substation and offices, the platform offers technology developers the opportunity to demonstrate their latest devices in test-friendly wave conditions. Along with a sister installation at Mutriku (Mutriku Wave Power Plant) BiMEP is able to provide a wide range of services in real sea conditions. In addition, a consortium made up of BiMEP and IH Cantabria has been tasked with developing a scientific and technological project called TRL+. The purpose of TRL+ is to offer innovative tailored solutions for the development of marine technologies from concept through to field testing.

name: CCMAR Ramalhete Marine Station
Address: Centro de Ciências do Mar, University of Algarve, Gambelas, 8005-139 Faro, Portugal
services_offered: CCMAR offers at the Ramalhete marine station, wet lab facilities with tanks of various sizes and controlled environment enabling the carrying out of a variety of experiments with larvae and juveniles of several fish species such as nutrition, behavior, general and specific physiology including acidification. Access is provided basic-routine equipment and consumables, and access to an open office. Costs for non-basic, on-routine chemicals/consumables are not included on the access. Complementary services include Molecular Biology (incl. sequencing and proteomics), Analytical Chemistry platforms and NGS data analysis pipeline but the costs will have to be covered by the user. Ramalhete Marine Station can provide access to projects requiring tanks of different capacities: 100L (n=24); 500L (n=20); 1000L (n=22); 3000L(3); 9000L(5). All tanks are set in flow-through systems supplied with filtered natural sea water collected in the nearby lagoon channel. A battery of 24 of 100L tanks in a flow-through with three (3) levels of CO2 for simulating oceanic acidification scenarios can be provided.  Tanks and space can be adapted to fulfill specific experimental needs as temperature control, photoperiod, light intensity or salinity. Access to some fish species can be provided under request, such as sole (Sole senegalensis), seabream (Sparus aurata) and seabass (Dicentrachus labrax). The available sizes are dependent on time of the year. Transport from CCMAR (Gambelas Campus of the University of Algarve) to Ramalhete Marine Station and return CCMAR is available during working days at 9a.m. and 17p.m.  Scientists or technicians directly involved in animal experimentation are required to have recognized personal licenses.

services_offered: The CRIACIV lab is involved in many activities: basic and applied research; consulting and technical development; research training at doctoral and postdoctoral levels; continuing professional development and training; scientific dissemination through conferences, seminars, workshop (also at International level). CRIACIV has a very strong industrial connection with many leading industries. Access covers both actual testing activities with pre- and post- process of data, and/or numerical studies (simulations, code development, validations, etc.). A typical access may consist of a pure experimental activity, a pure numerical activity or a combination of both. Access will be provided in the usual daily working hours of the laboratory. During each access, qualified staff is available for assisting hosts in using instruments, conducting tests, record data and post-process them. For accesses related to the numerical activities of the wind lab, support will be provided in the use of in-house developed software for studies in the field of wave-structure interaction (FSI) of fixed-bottom offshore wind turbines.

name: DanWEC test site
Address: Hamborgvej 40, 7730 Hanstholm
access_conditions: When a WEC developer wants to use the DanWEC test site and/or use other DanWEC services then an agreement is made between DanWEC and the WEC developer. The procedure is that a contract which describes the services is made, and it is signed by DanWEC and the WEC developer. DanWEC is working with international and national WEC developers.
services_offered: The Danish Wave Energy Centre (DanWEC) was established in 2010 as a centre for real sea testing of wave energy converters (WECs). The North Sea off the coast of Hanstholm features wave conditions convenient for testing pre-commercial WECs. DanWEC provides test conditions that compare to mid-Atlantic conditions approximately in scale 1:3 and to central North Sea conditions in scale 1:2. Since its establishment, DanWEC has contributed to creating a local base for knowledge, education and a workplace that has positioned the Danish test site as a reference European medium/half-scale test centre. Over the years five WEC developers has conducted real sea test around Hanstholm, and currently one Danish developer is deployed at the test site and it is very likely that other national and international developers will deploy their technologies during the coming years. At present stage, the DanWEC test site offers users a variety of facilities and services, such as near-real-time wave data from three buoys (two being directional wave measuring buoys) and from the weather station located on the harbour, onshore cable, a one-stop-shop scheme to apply for permits, and an office space.

access_conditions: Main conditions: Robust installation starting at TRL5 and upward.
services_offered: The Den Oever Sluice Gates are part of the Dutch waterworks and are located in the Afsluitdijk. This is a dam between the IJsselmeer (lake) and the Waddenzee (sea). The discharge sluices are used to discharge lake water to the sea to keep the lake level at measure. DMEC has the permits to use 2 sluice for testing tidal turbines in the discharge flow. DMEC offers the location, the logistics and knowledge to developers for testing their devices in a 'real environment' which is easy accessible and have pretty good predictable conditions.

name: EMEC Scale Wave Test Site (Scapa Flow)
Address: European Marine Energy Centre (EMEC) Ltd, Old Academy Business Centre, Stromness, Orkney, KW16 3AW
services_offered: EMEC’s clients benefit from a range of ready-made and cost-minimising test and demonstration facilities in major wave and tidal resources. Significant infrastructure investments have been made to make it as easy as possible for technology developers to learn by doing, with full confidentiality of performance data.  EMEC’s scale test sites offer a flexible sea space helping close the gap from tank testing, and acting as a stepping stone towards larger scale projects. Such accessible real sea testing enables marine energy developers and suppliers to learn lessons more cheaply, reducing the need for big vessels or large plant.  The site in Scapa Flow, to the south of Kirkwall, was chosen for its relatively benign waters which reach around 0.35m significant wave height. The site has a predominantly westerly wave regime in 21m-25m water, in an area 0.4km across and approximately 0.9km in length.

name: Genoa Experimental Marine Station (GEMS)
Type: Testing of sensors, corrosion protection, anti-fouling systems and MIC-inhibitors
Contact_person: Marco Faimali (Anti Fouling System and MIC)
Address: ISMAR-CNR, Via de Marini, 6, 16149 Genova, Italy
access_conditions: The shore station in the harbour of Genoa is available 24 hour per day for corrosion tests on infrastructure materials and for the evaluation of the protective and antifouling performances of coatings using suitable devices for exposition in immersed or in atmospheric marine environment. A support team formed by one young researcher and one head scientist will assist the user group, taking also care of installing/uninstalling operations. The station is on-land, so the user will have direct access. The data will be available to the user as soon as the user’s experiment is completed. The access to the harbour area is controlled by Genoa Harbour Authority whereas the access to Marine Station is regulated by the safety rules of CNR I.S.MAR.- U.O.S of Genoa.
data_examples: These structures allow the Institute and agencies or companies which make request to do several tests for material degradation behaviour and the antifouling technologies performance (efficacy and ecocompatibility) using natural seawater (corrosion resistance measurement, paint antifouling performance, biocide efficacy, biofilm development, microbial influenced corrosion (MIC), sensor performance, ballast water treatment, etc.) and to expose samples in standard conditions for ageing tests in marine atmosphere (coatings protective power evaluation, corrosion processes study, patinas monitoring, etc.).
services_offered: This coastal station is placed inside the Genoa harbour, with the possibility of monitoring environmental and biological parameters. indoor surface of 100 sqm, available for pilot plants and services, a 30 KW electrical system, an internet connection (5 Mb/s), a drinkable water pipe and a natural seawater circuit powered by a pump which draws the water at a depth of 2,5 meters, with a 12 liters for minute flow. A floating wharf (8,30x2,40 meters), used for the static immersion (Raft-test) of samples, isanchored in the Harbour area in front of the marine station. A weather station measures air temperature, atmospheric pressure, relative humidity, solar irradiance, rain rate, wind speed and direction, dew point temperature and presence of wet film. Data are stored on a computer system and transmitted daily by wireless communication. These data are used for the ageing tests in marine atmosphere (following ISO 8565) performed by the CNR ISMAR staff, and are available to companies and other interested parties on demand. This experimental station belongs to MARS Network - The European Network of Marine Research Institutes and Stations (http://www.marsnetwork.org/).

name: LABIMA - Laboratory of Maritime Engineering
Address: Via di S. Marta, 3 - 50139, Firenze (FI)
data_examples: Assessment of Tidal Energy Converters Assessment of Wave Energy Converters Stability of Port Breakwaters Overtopping at port breakwaters, sea dikes, seawall Shore defence structure effiency Hydrodynamic response of marine structures (wave energy devices, harbour dike, rubble-mound breakwaters, geo-containers). Analysis of wave energy conversion systems and design. Large scale evaluation of the potential energy of the sea, identification of exploitable areas and assessment of the interaction with waves, currents, sediment transport and dispersion of pollutants and morphy dynamics (by means of numerical simulations). Evaluation of the interaction between renewable energy devices - waves and dyanmics of the moorings in the area next to the structure, multi-scale interaction (i.e. turbulence) and non-linearity, which cannot be simulated with numerical models.
services_offered: Wave and current generation to specified requirements (e.g. site specific wave generation). Testing of scaled-model; Hydrodynamic performance of the device in a range of conditions; Limited survival (based on scale); Production of the power map of the device; Pressure and force measurements on device structural componenets (e.g. mooring behaviour). Validation of pre-completed numerical models. Data acquisition and analysis

name: PLOCAN MARINE TEST SITE
Address: Carretera de Taliarte, s, . Telde , Gran Canaria, Islas Canarias, 5635200 España
access_conditions: Public access
services_offered: The PLOCAN Marine Test Site is located on the East coast of Gran Canaria Island (Spain,www.plocan.eu). The Canary Islands are located in the Atlantic Ocean, south-west of Spain and Northwest of Africa. The marine test site includes an area of about 23 km 2 with a wide range of water depth from shoreline to 600 m. This Marine Test Site is available to projects focused on testing and demonstrating of all kinds of marine devices but mainly marine renewable energy converters. The final testing decision would be conditioned to the appropriateness, opportunity and availability of the facilities. The electrical and communication infrastructure is composed of two medium voltage cables (13.2kV) with a capacity of 5MW, each one, within the range of ±1% of 50Hz. The infrastructure will be mostly underwater, comprising hybrid cabling, with copper cables for the transmission of electrical power and fibre optics for data transmission, including a short terrestrial section to connect to the electrical substation on land. The onshore infrastructure will go from the manhole up to the electrical substation (66kV), where the electricity is raised up for its deliver to the national transmission grid. The onshore infrastructure will be composed by an underground medium voltage cable with a capacity of 15MW, by a power transformer station (13.2kV to 66kV) and all electrical protections required. This part will only be available after the Summer of 2017.

Address: Parque Tecnológico de Bizkaia, C/Geldo, Edificio 700 E-48160 Derio-Bizkaia (Spain)
data_examples: The test rig has been used in the following projects: Development of turbine and generator control algorithms for small scale wind turbines. Development of wind turbine grid connection control algorithms and test under distorted grid conditions, including voltage sags, frequency variations and harmonics.
services_offered: The Electrical PTO-Lab is a turbine emulator to reproduce the mechanical output of an ocean energy device/wind turbine. It consists of a HIL (Hardware in the Loop) test bench for grid connection of wind turbines and ocean energy converters, focused on testing electrical components (electrical generators and/or power converters). This test bench simulates the power production of a device with a rotary movement and it can be divided into three key elements: Device Emulator, Electrical Generator and Power Converter. Services currently offered by the infrastructure:  Mathematical Model validation. WEC Control: tuning of controllers, optimum efficiency control, peak to average power control. Grid connection control: Interaction between components in an electrical power network in various grid conditions, as strong grid, weak grid and island operation; Investigation of component behaviour during abnormal operation conditions, transient behaviour; Behaviour of converter control system in non- ideal network conditions, as weak grids and island operating modes, transient events, dips and circuit breaker operations etc. Final software testing. Electrical component testing.

name: WindScanner.eu
Type: Experimental Facility for Measurements of Offshore Wind Conditions - WindScanner Facility - SpinnerLidar
Address: Frederiksborgvej 399
access_conditions: Open Access on commercial terms and via fund raising
data_examples: WindScanner is a Unique operational Research Infrastructure able to scan and map 3D wind fields in huge volumes of air using synchronized and trajectory-coordinated scanning of the wind fields in the atmospheric boundary-layer on and offshore. In particular, the RI’s unique beam-steerable wind lidars enable sensing of the wind and turbulence fields by scanning the probing laser beams in the air flow in 3D at high spatial and temporal resolution. WindScanner.eu operate two separate systems of trajectory coordinated and synchronized scanning lidars, a short range (10-300 m range) and a long range (0.1 – 10 km) systems including control and data processing software, that provide the users with measurements of all three wind components for instance around single turbines and entire wind farms. In addition WindScanner has developed and operate a special SpinnerLidar able to scan the inflow at 400 points per second over the rotor plane for inflow and wake measurements from the nacelle or spi
services_offered: User Access, User training, data analysis Global Trans national access TNA

name: HARSHLAB-Floating laboratory in real offshore environment
Type: Floating laboratory for the assessment of the behaviour of materials, components, and equipment in real offshore environment
Address: Parque Científico y Tecnológico de Bizkaia. Astondo Bidea, Edificio 700 - E-48160 Derio (Bizkaia)
access_conditions: HarshLab is an infrastructure open both to private projects and collaborative public private partnership initiatives.
data_examples: During the testing processes a multitude of data are gathered: meteorological data, oceanographic data, corrosion rate, appearance, ageing antifouling, etc. This data set makes possible to to take decisions in the assessment of the behaviour of the materials, components, and equipment in a real offshore environment.  We can provide also valuable correlations between the observed variables, using advanced data analytics techniques.
location: Gulf of Biscay, 1,6 nautical miles from the coast
services_offered: Assessment of the behaviour of the materials, components, and equipment in real offshore environment: in the Atmospheric Zone; Splash zone; Immersion zone; Testing of components on the seabed. Mooring elements Riser, connectors and umbilicals testing; Testing equipment in service; Testing of offshore communication systems. A ROV for submarine inspections is also available
